channel.title: Episodes on Gladio Free Europe
channel.description: Recent content in Episodes on Gladio Free Europe

item.title: Yet More Bog Bodies
item.description: We talked about yet more bog bodies, as well as

item.title: The Bog Bodies
item.description: The bog bodies were subjects of captivation for centuries, but just who were these people and why were they deposited in bogs?

item.title: Hail, Caesar!
item.description: We used the Coen Brothers’ <!-- raw HTML omitted -->Hail, Caesar!<!-- raw HTML omitted --> as a jumping off point to discuss the early history of Hollywood, the studio system, and the infamous Eddie Mannix.

item.title: New Smyrna, A Greek Colony in Florida?
item.description: We look at a number of brutal episodes in early Florida colonial history highlighting New Smyrna, an attempt to built an agricultural colony with Greek indentured servants.

item.title: Queen Christina and the Swedish Empire ft. Anton
item.description: Matt Christman gives us the lay of the land in Central Europe in the period of the 30 Years’ War through reference to the 1971 film <!-- raw HTML omitted -->The Last Valley<!-- raw HTML omitted -->.

item.title: The Last Valley ft. Matt Christman
item.description: Matt Christman gives us the lay of the land in Central Europe in the period of the 30 Years’ War through reference to the 1971 film <!-- raw HTML omitted -->The Last Valley<!-- raw HTML omitted -->.

item.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
item.description: We excavate the 1942 classic The Man Who Came to Dinner and explore the lives of the personalities who inspired it.

item.title: Genetics 101 ft. Natasha
item.description: Gene Queen Natasha explains what genetics is, the lay of the land, and the practical and political implications of the Genetics Revolution.

item.title: Legendary Ancestry Claims
item.description: We examine how medieval and early modern European nobility imagined their families’ ancestors, the origins of such thinking, and how early nationalist movements came to think along similar lines.

item.title: Indigenous New England and the First Thanksgiving
item.description: An exploration of the history of the indigenous nations of Southern New England, their interactions with Europeans, the Puritans, and how the Thanksgiving story which we are all familiar with was concocted.

item.title: Cyrus Teed and Koreshanity
item.description: We explore the strange contours of the life of Cyrus Teed, an eccentric 19th century prophet who founded a celibate cult centered around feminism, socialism, and the hollow earth theory.

item.title: The Golem
item.description: Wherein we discuss the 1920 German classic <!-- raw HTML omitted -->The Golem: How He Came Into The World<!-- raw HTML omitted --> as well as the religious and philosophical underpinnings of the golem figure writ large.

item.title: A Global History of Dragons
item.description: From Britain to Beijing, cultures all around the world independently created the idea of dragons. In this episode, we try to find out why.

item.title: Readings From Ramón Sender's The Magnet
item.description: We briefly explain the relationship between the Rif War and the rise of Spanish fascism, and read excerpts from The Magnet.

item.title: History of Morocco (Part 2)
item.description: We continue our telling of the history of Morocco, going through to the beginning of the 19th century and explaining the factors behind the Moroccan state’s structural weakness.

item.title: The Barbary Pirates
item.description: We take a slight detour in our history of Morocco series to discuss the Barbary Pirate phenomenon.

item.title: E. Howard Hunt, Novelist
item.description: The gang explores E. Howard Hunt’s crimes against literature committed over the course of his side-career as a pulp fiction novelist.

item.title: History of Morocco (Part 1)
item.description: The first part of our exploration of Moroccan history, the most important country that Americans have hardly heard of.

item.title: The Arab-Norman Civilization (Part 2)
item.description: We continue our journey into medieval Sicily by following the rag-tag band of Normans who carved out a tiny foothold on the Italian peninsula

item.title: The Arab-Norman Civilization (Part 1)
item.description: The sun-soaked island of Sicily has been influenced by cultures from every corner of the Mediterranean and beyond and is an amazing microcosm for the entire history of Europe and the Middle East as well.

item.title: Origins of the Normans
item.description: A thousand years ago, a group of barbarian pirates fought their way into becoming one of the most powerful clans in all Europe

item.title: Dirty Harry
item.description: As the Zodiac is tormenting San Francisco, a movie about a SFPD cop taking down a serial killer is released

item.title: The World of Casablanca
item.description: The gang takes a deep dive into the circumstances that produced the most celebrated picture in Hollywood history

item.title: The Northman
item.description: Prince Amleth is now a Viking who’s on a mission to save his mother, kill his uncle, and avenge his father.

item.title: Eldridge Cleaver, Black Panther
item.description: We’re back in North Korea, this time by way of the Black Panther Party

item.title: Serpico ft. Derek
item.description: Al Pacino plays Frank Serpico, a real life cop who went up against the sleaze and corruption in the 70s NYPD

item.title: Prelude to Mandate Palestine ft. Kevin
item.description: Our friend Kevin is back to discuss British era Palestine for our Interwar Series

item.title: Spiritualism in the 1800s
item.description: We take a look back at a time when the ghosts of men were possessing spirit mediums all over the country to tell tales of life on the other side

item.title: Prelude to Mandate Palestine ft. Kevin
item.description: Our friend Kevin is back to discuss Palestine for our Interwar Series from the late Ottoman period, to the first World War, to the breakup of the Ottoman Empire.

item.title: Ohio vs the Ku Klux Klan ft. Jern
item.description: Jern from Ohio tells us about the working-class Ohio immigrants who formed their own secret society to oppose the Ku Klux Klan

item.title: Fritz Lang’s M
item.description: M tells the story of a town shaken by a string of serial murders by a killer who targets young girls.

item.title: Interwar Series: After The Revolutions ft. Brendan
item.description: We’re joined by our friend Brendan to discuss some of the various small-time revolutions and revolutionaries in Europe and the Americas.

item.title: The Franks ft. Natasha
item.description: From Germanic barbarians on the edge of the Empire to running the whole show

item.title: A World Between Worlds
item.description: Part 1 of our ongoing series on the happenings during the years between the first and second world wars

item.title: The Time That Remains ft. Fathi
item.description: Fathi joins us to discuss the film and the daily life of “Israeli-Arabs”

item.title: Late Roman Empire
item.description: Like all bad things, the Roman Empire came to an end. But why did it take hundreds of years for that to happen?

item.title: Catholicism 101 ft. James
item.description: Our friend James returns to give Russian Sam a crash course in Catholicism and how it differs from other Christian denominations.

item.title: Failed Colonial Ventures of the Americas
item.description: The New World gave birth to many colonies we know and love today, but it also birthed some colonies that didn’t quite make it

item.title: The Lion in Winter and Medieval Christmas
item.description: An aging and conniving King Henry II of England and Ireland plans a reunion where he hopes to name his successor

item.title: Sympathy Seeker
item.description: Run along children, you don’t want to be awake when Ded Moroz comes to leave you presents under the New Year Tree

item.title: Quo Vadis ft. Maggie
item.description: Set against the back drop of Rome in crisis, General Marcus Vinicius returns to the city as Nero’s atrocities become more extreme until he burns Rome, laying the blame on the Christians.

item.title: Lust, Caution ft. Carl Zha
item.description: Carl Zha joins us to discuss Ang Lee’s Lust, Caution, a film about a secret agent that must seduce then assassinate an official who works for the Japanese puppet government in Shanghai.

item.title: Shadows of Forgotten Ancestors ft. Jim
item.description: Our friend Jim comes on the pod to take us on a journey to Ukraine and it’s various cast of characters

item.title: Skating
item.description: surfs up, we’re hanging ten on some concrete waves

item.title: Kievan Rus'
item.description: We venture into the eastern fringes of Europe to look at the origins of Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus: the Kievan Rus'

item.title: Global Americanization
item.description: Our most death to america episode yet

item.title: Shadow of the Vampire
item.description: Nosferatu is the silent era horror film whose creation we watched dramatized in Shadow of the Vampire

item.title: The Iron Giant ft. Daniel Bessner
item.description: The Iron Giant asks us, how would American react if a sentient giant robot crash landed from space in the height of the Cold War?

item.title: Zionism ft. Kevin
item.description: Our good friend Kevin is back to help use trace the roots of Zionism as an ideology and the various religious, colonialist, or nationalist strands that existed before 1948.

item.title: Columbus Day
item.description: Why is Christopher Columbus considered a hero to Italian-Americans, and why did they fight so hard to give us a national holiday to celebrate him?

item.title: Soy Cuba ft. Jaime
item.description: This Soviet made piece of art, Soy Cuba, tells four stories during the final days of the Batista regime.

item.title: Charlie Wilson's War
item.description: Charlie Wilson was a Texan Congressman whose involvement with the Afghan people and the Mujahideen was immortalized in the film Charlie Wilson’s War.

item.title: Seven Days in May
item.description: A military coup, a general gone mad, and a whole country gone mad with anti-communist fervor.

item.title: The Last Kingdom
item.description: Continuing on the themes discussed in E13, we go back to England and discuss the BBC show The Last Kingdom, and the topic of Viking invasions of the British Isles.

item.title: Les Rallizes Dénudés ft. Zach
item.description: Les Rallizes Dénudés was a pioneer of the psychedelic drone rock sound, but they’re nowhere near as famous as their contemporaries like Boris. Why is that?

item.title: Migration and Memory
item.description: Was King Arthur an Englishman? Did ancient Turks build every civilization in history?

item.title: Inside the Internet ft. Pam
item.description: The Internet is what gives us power. It’s an energy field created by all artificial things. It surrounds us. It penetrates us. It binds humanity together.

item.title: West Beirut ft. Liam
item.description: A young man comes of age in West Beirut as his country descends into civil war

item.title: To Live ft. Cnut
item.description: One family’s struggle to endure civil war, hardship, tragedy, and shadow puppets.

item.title: S1m0ne ft. Pam
item.description: What if we replaced actors with computers? A thought provoking question that we’re still grappling with the answer to 20 years later.

item.title: Beware of the Car
item.description: A insurance agent moonlights as a car thief and steals cars from various crooks to give back to the people.

item.title: Hernán and Aztec Empire ft. Paul Guinan
item.description: Two works of art offering radically different depicitions the dramatic fall of the mightiest empire in the Americas.

item.title: True Detective (season 2)
item.description: True Detective S2 explores the world of LA corruption, money, power, and the sleaze the can buy.

item.title: The Parallax View ft. James
item.description: An ambitious reporter, investigating a senator’s assassination, realizes witnesses to the shooting are systematically dying and discovers a multi-million dollar corporation which serves as a front for the recruitment of political assassins.

item.title: Barbarians
item.description: Barbarians is a German historical drama that tells the story of Arminus, a Germanic Barbarian raised in Rome, and sent back to Germania a Roman soldier

item.title: Wag the Dog
item.description: The night before news of the President’s sex scandal is made public, the White House devises a plan to fake a war with Albania to distract the media, and the American public

item.title: The Wind That Shakes the Barley ft. James
item.description: We’re joined by James to discuss the 2006 film The Wind That Shakes the Barley, and the Irish War of Independence.

item.title: Yegor Letov and the National Bolsheviks
item.description: The Soviet Union, Punk Rock, Communism, KGB repression, Fascism, and more in this episode about Siberian singer and songwriter Yegor Letov
